study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of Coenzyme Q10 in treating rheumatic diseases, focusing on its efficacy and safety.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation improved disease activity, inflammatory biomarkers, and symptoms in Rheumatoid Arthritis and Fibromyalgia patients, while also enhancing endothelial function in Antiphospholipid Syndrome. The treatment was well-tolerated with minor side effects reported in two studies.
population_specificity: Patients with rheumatic diseases (Fibromyalgia, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Antiphospholipid Syndrome).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a mitochondrion-targeted nanocarrier loaded with Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10@TNPs) could mitigate cold ischaemia-reperfusion injury in cardiac grafts during heart transplantation.
results_summary: CoQ10@TNPs successfully delivered CoQ10 to mitochondria, reducing oxidative stress, mitochondrial injury, and inflammation, thereby improving cardiac graft function in both in vitro and in vivo models.
population_specificity: Murine heterotopic cardiac transplantation model (donor hearts) and H9c2 cells (in vitro).
study_duration: 12 hours of cold storage (in vivo), treatment duration in vitro not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10) and L-carnitine supplementation could improve outcomes in older men with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) when used alongside finasteride.
results_summary: CoQ10 and L-carnitine supplementation significantly reduced prostate volume and improved erectile function but did not significantly affect urinary symptoms, quality of life, or PSA levels compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Older men with BPH and lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation on chronic fatigue and pain symptoms as a potential therapeutic strategy for post-viral fatigue syndrome (PVFS).
results_summary: The abstract suggests that mitochondrial dysfunction is linked to PVFS and reviews evidence supporting Coenzyme Q10's role in addressing fatigue and pain symptoms, though specific efficacy results are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with post-viral fatigue syndrome, including myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS), fibromyalgia (FM), and post-COVID-19 condition (long COVID).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CoQ10 could alleviate hyperlipidemia-induced osteoporosis by regulating adipocyte-osteoblast lineage allocation and improving mitochondrial function via the miR-130b-3p/PGC-1α pathway.
results_summary: CoQ10 reversed elevated serum lipid levels and improved bone formation markers in HFD-treated ApoE-/- mice and ox-LDL-treated BMSCs. It also restored PGC-1α expression, mitochondrial function, and reduced ROS generation, promoting osteogenic differentiation over adipogenic differentiation.
population_specificity: ApoE-/- mice fed a high-fat diet and BMSCs treated with oxidized LDL.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine differences in medical application and efficacy between CoQ10 and CoQH2 supplementation for preventing cardiovascular disease in patients with heart failure.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation reduced cardiovascular death in heart failure patients, while CoQH2 showed antioxidative and anti-inflammatory properties but no cardiovascular mortality benefits. Long-term positive effects were only observed with CoQ10.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation on oxidative status and lipid profile in individuals with episodic migraine.
results_summary: Co-Q10 supplementation significantly reduced malondialdehyde (MDA) levels and increased HDL-C levels, but had no effect on total antioxidant capacity (TAC) or other lipid profile variables. It also improved clinical features and reduced body fat percentage (BFP).
population_specificity: Females aged 18-50 years diagnosed with episodic migraine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the clinical manifestations and treatment outcomes of primary CoQ10 deficiency caused by COQ4 variants, focusing on the efficacy of oral CoQ10 supplementation.
results_summary: The study found that oral CoQ10 supplementation may improve or stabilize disease severity in patients with primary CoQ10 deficiency, particularly those with the COQ4 c.370G>A variant. Early diagnosis and treatment were emphasized as critical for better outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with primary CoQ10 deficiency, particularly those with COQ4 variants, including two siblings with infantile-onset seizures, developmental delay, cardiomyopathy, and brain atrophy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ), alone or in combination with selenium (Se), could prevent testicular dysfunction caused by cadmium (Cd) exposure in rats by mitigating oxidative stress and inflammation.
results_summary: CoQ, when combined with Se, almost completely prevented Cd-induced oxidative stress, inflammation, and steroidogenic suppression, including transcriptomic changes, while CoQ alone did not show significant protective effects. The combination reduced differentially expressed genes (DEGs) from 1192 to 29, indicating a 97.6% protection rate.
population_specificity: Adult male rats exposed to cadmium.
interactions: Synergistic effect with selenium noted; no other interactions mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of CoQ10 supplementation on oxidative stress, inflammation, and clinical symptoms in patients with Multiple Sclerosis (MS).
results_summary: The study found that 500mg/day of CoQ10 improved oxidative stress, inflammation, and symptoms like depression and fatigue in MS patients, while 200mg/day showed controversial results. The evidence was limited by the small number of included studies.
population_specificity: Patients with Multiple Sclerosis (MS)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of mitochondrial nutrients, including Coenzyme Q10, in counteracting carcinogenesis, controlling cancer cell proliferation, and mitigating side effects of prooxidative anticancer drugs.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that combinations of mitochondrial nutrients, including Coenzyme Q10, may help restore redox balance, mitigate side effects of anticancer drugs, and aid in cancer prevention or adjuvant therapy, though specific results for Coenzyme Q10 alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract discusses general potential applications in cancer models or adjuvant therapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether coenzyme Q10 could prevent contrast-induced acute kidney injury (CI-AKI) in diabetic patients by acting as a mitochondrial-targeted antioxidant.
results_summary: The study found no favorable effect of coenzyme Q10 on preventing CI-AKI or improving urinary mtDNA/nDNA ratios in diabetic patients, with similar outcomes between the Q10 and placebo groups for most measured parameters.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients undergoing angiography.
study_duration: Four days, starting 24 hours before contrast media injection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify the effect of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation on serum concentrations of liver function enzymes through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized clinical trials.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation significantly reduced serum concentrations of ALT, AST, and GGT, but had no significant effect on alkaline phosphatase levels. The findings suggest CoQ10 may positively affect liver function, though further high-quality RCTs are needed for confirmation.
population_specificity: Patients in randomized clinical trials assessing liver function enzymes (specific population details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the neuroprotective effects of Coenzyme Q10 in cerebral ischemia-reperfusion injury and explore its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 significantly reduced ischemic damage, increased IL-10 and total antioxidant capacity, and decreased inflammatory markers (IL-6, TNF-α, ICAM-1, NF-κB p65) in rats. It demonstrated neuroprotective properties likely due to anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidative effects.
population_specificity: Adult male rats weighing 200-300 grams.
effective_dosage: Not specified (only mentions "seven days of Coenzyme Q10 pretreatment").

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical outcome of Coenzyme Q10 therapy in a patient with PDSS1 mutations causing multisystem mitochondrial disease.
results_summary: High-dose Coenzyme Q10 therapy had no effect on the patient's advanced-stage disease, showing no improvement in clinical outcomes. The study suggests further data is needed to evaluate potential benefits of early intervention.
population_specificity: A female patient with compound heterozygous PDSS1 mutations presenting with developmental delay, regression, and steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome leading to chronic kidney disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Coenzyme Q10 as an intervention for managing long covid symptoms.
results_summary: The study found no compelling evidence to support the effectiveness of Coenzyme Q10 in managing long covid symptoms.
population_specificity: Adults (≥18 years) with long covid.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Coenzyme Q10 as a potential treatment for Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) in children and adolescents.
results_summary: The study found promising evidence of efficacy for Coenzyme Q10 in treating ASD, along with a high safety profile, suggesting it may be considered for clinical use with caution.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether preoperative CoQ10 supplementation improves oocyte quality and quantity in women with diminished ovarian reserves after hysterectomy with bilateral salpingectomy.
results_summary: The abstract suggests CoQ10 may improve oocyte quality and quantity, but specific results or statistical significance are not provided. The study compares a 14-day preoperative CoQ10 intervention, but detailed outcomes are not described.
population_specificity: Reproductive-age women with benign gynecological diseases and diminished ovarian reserves after hysterectomy with bilateral salpingectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Coenzyme Q10 in reducing oxidative stress and improving mitochondrial function in the context of aging and related diseases.
results_summary: The study found that Coenzyme Q10 demonstrated potential in reducing oxidative stress, contributing to improved mitochondrial health and mitigating age-related decline.
population_specificity: Not specified (general aging population implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Coenzyme Q10, in combination with high-resolution respirometry, for early detection of mitochondrial dysfunction and monitoring therapeutic outcomes.
results_summary: The study suggests that measuring endogenous CoQ10 levels alongside mitochondrial bioenergetics via HRR can aid in early detection of mitochondrial dysfunction and assess treatment efficacy. CoQ10 supplementation is highlighted as one therapeutic strategy to improve mitochondrial function and reduce oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Individuals suspected of having mitochondrial illnesses (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether Coenzyme Q10 could mitigate hypoxia-induced mitochondrial dysfunction in cardiovascular diseases by regulating mitochondrial dynamics and reducing oxidative stress.
results_summary: The study found that Coenzyme Q10, along with statins, showed promise in enhancing mitochondrial quality control, reducing ROS production, and improving mitochondrial biogenesis and mitophagy under hypoxic conditions. These effects suggest potential therapeutic benefits for hypoxia-related cardiovascular diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on cardiovascular diseases like congenital heart disease, myocardial infarction, and heart failure).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between CoQ10 and physical frailty, focusing on its potential role in modifying frailty risk.
results_summary: The abstract notes that the association between CoQ10 and frailty was mainly assessed in observational studies, with insufficient robust evidence from randomized controlled trials to support clinical recommendations.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals at risk of or experiencing physical frailty.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether Coenzyme Q10, as a pharmacological agent targeting mitochondrial function, could improve outcomes in assisted reproduction.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that Coenzyme Q10 shows promise in improving assisted reproduction outcomes, but specific results or statistical significance are not detailed.
population_specificity: Oocytes and embryos in the context of assisted reproduction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential benefits of Coenzyme Q10 as part of dietary strategies for addressing muscle loss in individuals with heart failure.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that Coenzyme Q10 may offer benefits as a micronutrient in managing muscle wasting in heart failure patients, though specific efficacy data are not detailed.
population_specificity: Individuals with heart failure experiencing sarcopenia (muscle loss).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the off-target effects of statins, including their inhibition of Coenzyme Q10 synthesis and its impact on mitochondrial function.
results_summary: The study found that statins inhibit Coenzyme Q10 synthesis, impairing the functioning of mitochondrial complexes I and II, which may contribute to statin-related side effects such as musculoskeletal symptoms. Some off-target effects of statins, including those related to Coenzyme Q10, could also have favorable outcomes in conditions like inflammatory disorders and cancer.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of statin effects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of antioxidants, particularly Coenzyme Q10, in improving fertility outcomes for women with ovarian aging.
results_summary: CoQ10 significantly improved retrieved oocyte numbers, high-quality embryo rates, and clinical pregnancy rates, with optimal effects at 30 mg/d for 3 months before ovarian stimulation. It outperformed other antioxidants like melatonin and vitamins.
population_specificity: Women with ovarian aging, particularly those with diminished ovarian reserve and aged <35 years.
study_duration: 3 months before the controlled ovarian stimulation cycle

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective effects of Coenzyme Q10 as a mitochondria-targeted antioxidant in Huntington's disease.
results_summary: The study suggests Coenzyme Q10 may improve mitochondrial function and antioxidant activity in Huntington's disease, but its impact is less effective compared to other MTAXs. The abstract does not provide specific efficacy data for Coenzyme Q10 alone.
population_specificity: Preclinical and clinical studies related to Huntington's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify the role of Coenzyme Q10 in ferroptosis suppression via FSP1 and explore its potential as a target for treating refractory cancers.
results_summary: The study found that Coenzyme Q10, in its antioxidant form, is produced by FSP1 and contributes to cancer cell resistance against ferroptosis, independent of the GSH pathway. Targeting FSP1 to inhibit Coenzyme Q10 production may weaken ferroptosis resistance in refractory cancers.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro or theoretical context, not specified in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of topical CoQ10 on early wound healing and root coverage after gingival recession surgery.
results_summary: CoQ10 showed no significant effect on early wound healing or mean root coverage after 6 months, though complete root coverage was higher in the test group (60% vs. 13.3%). Pain recovery time was shorter with CoQ10, but other outcomes like keratinized tissue width and esthetics were similar between groups.
population_specificity: Thirty patients with buccal gingival recessions.
effective_dosage: Not specified (topical spray applied for 21 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the ubiquinone-ubiquinol redox cycle of Coenzyme Q10 and its clinical implications, including potential benefits of CoQ10 and selenium co-supplementation.
results_summary: The study highlights the essential role of CoQ10 in cellular metabolism, detailing its redox cycle involving mitochondrial and extra-mitochondrial enzymes. It also reviews clinical outcomes of deficiencies in this cycle and suggests potential benefits of CoQ10 and selenium co-supplementation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review, not a clinical trial)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation on clinical outcomes in patients with diabetic nephropathy.
results_summary: Low-quality evidence suggested that Coenzyme Q10 supplementation significantly improved HbA1c, total cholesterol (TC), and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) in patients with diabetic nephropathy. The outcomes were classified as class IV evidence due to small sample sizes.
population_specificity: Patients with diabetic nephropathy (DN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of Coenzyme Q10 in the ferroptosis inhibition system and its potential therapeutic implications for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The study highlights Coenzyme Q10 as part of the ferroptosis suppressor protein 1 (FSP1)/CoQ10/NADPH regulatory axis, which plays a protective role against ferroptosis in NAFLD progression. It suggests that CoQ10 may help mitigate iron homeostasis imbalance and associated oxidative stress in NAFLD.
population_specificity: Individuals with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), including conditions like hepatic steatosis, NASH, liver fibrosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence and recommendations from leading scientific societies regarding the use of Coenzyme Q10 as a nutraceutical intervention for Peyronie's disease.
results_summary: The study found conflicting recommendations on Coenzyme Q10, with the Canadian Urological Association suggesting it might be offered as a treatment option, while the American Urological Association refrained from taking a definitive stance due to insufficient evidence.
population_specificity: Patients with Peyronie's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the latest recommendations for lifestyle and pharmacological treatment of diabetic cardiomyopathy, including the potential role of Coenzyme Q10.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that Coenzyme Q10, along with other compounds, is being researched for its potential to improve control and treatment of diabetic cardiomyopathy, but specific results are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with diabetes mellitus and diabetic cardiomyopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cognitive and physiological effects of coenzyme Q10, particularly when co-administered with PQQ, including its impact on memory, attention, and mitochondrial function.
results_summary: Co-administration of PQQ and coenzyme Q10 enhanced cognitive flexibility and executive speed, particularly in young adults (20-40 years old), and improved general memory, verbal memory, working memory, and attention. Additionally, PQQ and coenzyme Q10 showed benefits in sleep, mood, and skin moisture retention.
population_specificity: Young adults (20-40 years old) and older adults (41-65 years old)
effective_dosage: Not specified for coenzyme Q10 (PQQ baseline intake was 20 mg/day)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of selenium and coenzyme Q10 supplementation on thyroid hormone regulation in individuals with varying baseline selenium levels.
results_summary: The study found that individuals with the lowest baseline selenium levels had higher TSH and lower fT3 levels, and supplementation with selenium and coenzyme Q10 improved thyroid hormone levels in this group.
population_specificity: 414 individuals with varying baseline selenium concentrations.
effective_dosage: Not specified for coenzyme Q10 (selenium dosage was 200 µg/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of Coenzyme Q10 and other nutrients in immune system function, particularly in patients with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Coenzyme Q10's effects, only mentioning its consideration among other nutrients for immune modulation in type 2 diabetes.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential therapeutic role of Coenzyme Q10 in mitigating mitochondrial dysfunction in Fragile X syndrome (FXS) and Fragile X-associated tremor/ataxia syndrome (FXTAS).
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on Coenzyme Q10's effects but suggests it is among the mitochondrial cofactors and antioxidants examined for potential therapeutic benefits in FXS and FXTAS.
population_specificity: Individuals with Fragile X syndrome (FXS) and Fragile X-associated tremor/ataxia syndrome (FXTAS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of CoQ10 supplementation on endothelial function, specifically focusing on markers like Flow Mediated Dilation (FMD), VCAM, and ICAM.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation significantly improved FMD in a dose-dependent manner but did not affect VCAM or ICAM levels. The effect on FMD was robust and observed after 8 weeks of consumption.
population_specificity: 489 subjects from 12 studies (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).
study_duration: Effects on FMD were noted after 8 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of Coenzyme Q10 in mitigating mitochondrial oxidative damage and enhancing healthy aging.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that Coenzyme Q10, among other interventions, may help reduce mitochondrial oxidative damage, a key factor in aging, though specific results are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general aging population implied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of Coenzyme Q10 (specifically its synthetic analogue idebenone) as an antioxidant for treating oxidative retinopathies when formulated as eye drops.
results_summary: The study suggests that idebenone, a synthetic analogue of Coenzyme Q10, contributes to cellular protection against oxidative injury in the retina, potentially offering a targeted therapeutic approach when delivered via eye drops. The abstract highlights the synergistic potential of combining idebenone with other antioxidants for enhanced efficacy.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on oxidative retinopathies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of CoQ10 supplementation on inflammation, oxidative stress, and clinical outcomes in burn patients.
results_summary: CoQ10 administration did not significantly affect inflammatory markers (CRP, ESR) or oxidative stress markers (TAC, MDA, SOD), but it significantly increased albumin levels compared to placebo. No other significant differences were observed in the measured outcomes.
population_specificity: Burn patients
effective_dosage: 100 mg three times a day (total 300 mg/day)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the clinical and genetic characteristics of a patient with COQ8A-ataxia and assess the effectiveness of CoQ10 supplementation in treating the condition.
results_summary: The study found that CoQ10 supplementation did not significantly improve the patient's symptoms, and a review of previous literature showed only half of patients experienced notable improvement in ataxia. The identified COQ8A variants reduced mitochondrial protein expression and function, increasing oxidative stress.
population_specificity: An 18-year-old patient with COQ8A-ataxia (primary CoQ10 deficiency-4).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of selenium and coenzyme Q10 supplementation on SELENOP levels and associated health outcomes, including inflammation, quality of life, and mortality.
results_summary: Supplementation with selenium and coenzyme Q10 increased SELENOP levels, which were associated with reduced inflammation, better quality of life, and decreased mortality. High SELENOP levels also correlated with longer telomere lengths.
population_specificity: 403 elderly community-living participants with low selenium levels.
effective_dosage: 200 μg/day selenium yeast (coenzyme Q10 dosage not specified).

study_goal: The study does not specifically investigate Coenzyme Q10 but mentions it as part of iron-containing proteins involved in mitochondrial respiration and other cellular functions.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Coenzyme Q10's effects, focusing instead on broader iron metabolism and associated diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of iron metabolism in humans)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a nonprescription supplement containing Coenzyme Q10, among other ingredients, could reduce symptom frequency and severity in patients with vestibular migraine.
results_summary: The study found that the supplement combination, including Coenzyme Q10, led to significant improvements in symptom severity and frequency, with 44-45% improvement across multiple measures. About half of the participants reported symptom improvement, while the supplement was well-tolerated.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with vestibular migraine (78% female, mean age 44 ± 14 years) from two Sydney tertiary referral clinics.
effective_dosage: Coenzyme Q10 75 mg (as part of a combination product taken once daily).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the role of Coenzyme Q10, among other nutritional antioxidants, in mitigating oxidative stress caused by adrenal hormone imbalances.
results_summary: The review suggests that Coenzyme Q10, along with other antioxidants, may help alleviate oxidative stress associated with adrenal hormone dysregulation, though specific efficacy data for Coenzyme Q10 alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: General discussion of adrenal hormone disorders (e.g., adrenal insufficiency, Cushing's syndrome, adrenal tumors) without specifying a particular study population.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the mechanistic, epidemiologic, and clinical evidence supporting the use of Coenzyme Q10 in antiphospholipid syndrome (APS).
results_summary: The abstract suggests Coenzyme Q10 may have antithrombotic, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant properties relevant to APS, but specific results are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with antiphospholipid syndrome (APS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential efficacy of metabolic treatments, including Coenzyme Q10, in pediatric migraine cases, particularly in the context of abdominal migraine.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that metabolic treatments with Coenzyme Q10 were effective in several cases of pediatric migraine, but overall results on metabolic treatments in children are scarce and nonconclusive.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with abdominal migraine, especially those with coexisting obesity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Coenzyme Q10, in combination with selenium, could modify the progression of proBNPage, a surrogate marker of biological age, in older adults.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Coenzyme Q10's effects, as the study is described as ongoing with planned assessments over 2 years.
population_specificity: Adults aged 65-80 years, free of cardiovascular diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the comparative effectiveness of Coenzyme Q10 in improving lipid metabolism in patients with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 was the most effective supplement in reducing triglycerides (TG), total cholesterol (TC), and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) levels, with high SUCRAs scores (87.71%, 98.78%, and 98.70%, respectively). No significant differences were observed in HDL-C, TT, SHBG, or CRP levels compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Patients with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of Coenzyme Q10 in ferroptosis and its potential implications for disease treatment, particularly in relation to macrophages.
results_summary: The abstract summarizes the association between macrophages and ferroptosis, highlighting Coenzyme Q10's involvement in the process, but does not provide specific results on its efficacy or safety.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of disease pathology).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to explore the potential of mitochondria-targeted drugs, including OXPHOS inhibitors, as antitumor therapeutics, focusing on their efficacy and safety.
results_summary: The abstract discusses the challenges of OXPHOS inhibitors, such as neurotoxicity and lactic acidosis in clinical trials, but does not mention Coenzyme Q10 specifically.
population_specificity: Patients with acute myeloid leukemia and mouse models (no specific mention of Coenzyme Q10).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the pleiotropic effects of Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10) in female reproductive disorders, focusing on its potential mechanisms and therapeutic benefits.
results_summary: The study found that CoQ10 reduces oxidative stress, enhances mitochondrial activity, regulates gene expression, inhibits inflammatory responses, and improves ovarian function, oocyte maturation, and embryonic development. It also highlights CoQ10's role in immune balance and metabolism regulation.
population_specificity: Women with infertility or recurrent spontaneous abortion, as well as general female reproductive health.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective potential of Coenzyme Q10 in mitigating Parkinson's disease-associated pathologies, such as dopaminergic neuron degeneration and α-synuclein aggregation.
results_summary: The study highlights Coenzyme Q10 as a promising natural compound with neuroprotective effects in experimental models of PD, including attenuation of dopaminergic neuron degeneration and modulation of neuroinflammatory responses. However, clinical evidence remains limited, necessitating further research.
population_specificity: Preclinical studies and in vitro experiments (not specified for human populations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effects of Coenzyme Q10 on oocyte maturation and its role in fetal development across different stages.
results_summary: The study found that CoQ10 plays a crucial role in oocyte maturation and supports the growth of various organs during fetal development, suggesting potential benefits for fertility quality.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of oocyte maturation and fetal development).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe a case of Primary Coenzyme Q10 Deficiency-7 and its clinical manifestations in an infant.
results_summary: The study identified a pathogenic variant in the COQ4 gene in an infant presenting with neurological and dysmorphic symptoms, suggesting Coenzyme Q10 deficiency as a potential diagnosis. No treatment outcomes or efficacy of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation were reported.
population_specificity: A 3-month-and-22-day-old male infant with hypotonia, metabolic acidosis, and elevated serum lactate levels.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of CoQ10 supplementation in hepatocellular carcinoma, focusing on its anti-cancer properties and protective effects against chemotherapy-induced damage.
results_summary: The study found that CoQ10 supplementation reduces oxidative stress, minimizes tissue damage, and may protect against chemotherapy-induced harm by lowering inflammatory cytokines. It also suggests potential anti-cancer effects in hepatocellular carcinoma.
population_specificity: Cancer patients, particularly those with hepatocellular carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical therapeutic effect of topical CoQ10 versus topical corticosteroids in managing symptomatic oral lichen planus (OLP) and assess whether CoQ10's effect was linked to its antioxidant activity.
results_summary: Both CoQ10 and corticosteroid groups showed significant reductions in pain and lesion size with no statistical difference between them, and this improvement correlated with decreased salivary malondialdehyde (MDA) levels.
population_specificity: 34 patients with symptomatic oral lichen planus (OLP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether a multinutrient supplement containing Coenzyme Q10, as an adjunct to periodontal therapy, improved clinical outcomes in periodontitis patients.
results_summary: The multinutrient supplement, including Coenzyme Q10, showed significantly greater reductions in probing pocket depth and bleeding on probing compared to placebo, though other periodontal parameters did not show statistically significant improvements.
population_specificity: 42 patients with stage III or IV periodontitis.
effective_dosage: Not specified (part of a multinutrient supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review existing literature on the effects of various nutrients, including Coenzyme Q10, on fatigue in different populations.
results_summary: Among the 60 included studies, 50 showed significant beneficial effects of nutrients on fatigue, suggesting potential efficacy of Coenzyme Q10 in mitigating fatigue symptoms.
population_specificity: Individuals with conditions such as fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue syndrome, cancer, and multiple sclerosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the role of FSP1 in ferroptosis regulation, including its interaction with Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10) in the FSP1-CoQ10-NAD(P)H axis.
results_summary: The study highlights that FSP1 functions through the FSP1-CoQ10-NAD(P)H axis and is associated with disease prognosis and treatment, particularly in malignant tumors. CoQ10's role in this regulatory pathway suggests its potential importance in modulating ferroptosis-related diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article summarizing existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize evidence on the effects of CoQ10 on cardiac function and quality of life in heart failure patients.
results_summary: The study reviewed existing evidence but did not specify conclusive results in the abstract; it focused on synthesizing data on CoQ10's impact on heart failure outcomes.
population_specificity: Heart failure patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the lipid-lowering activity and safety of a dietary supplement containing Coenzyme Q10 combined with monacolin K, grape seed, and olive tree leaf extracts in patients with mild hypercholesterolemia.
results_summary: The study found that the supplement containing Coenzyme Q10 and monacolin K significantly reduced LDL-C by 26.46% on average, indicating potential efficacy in lowering cholesterol levels. However, the abstract does not specify Coenzyme Q10's individual contribution to these effects.
population_specificity: 105 subjects with mild hypercholesterolemia (LDL-C levels 140-180 mg/dL) and low cardiovascular risk.
effective_dosage: Not specified for Coenzyme Q10 (monacolin K dosages were 3 mg and 10 mg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Coenzyme Q10 as a nutraceutical option for migraine prophylaxis in postoperative microsurgical patients.
results_summary: The study suggests Coenzyme Q10 may be a viable alternative for migraine prophylaxis, minimizing the need for additional medications postoperatively, though specific efficacy data is not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing reconstructive microsurgery with migraine symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of non-pharmaceutical interventions, including Coenzyme Q10, in improving sperm quality parameters for male infertility.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 showed significant advantages in improving sperm forward motility (MD, 5.28 (95% CI, 2.70 to 7.86)), indicating a positive effect on sperm quality. The study grouped CoQ10 with other interventions that collectively improved sperm parameters, suggesting its potential benefit in treating male infertility.
population_specificity: Males with infertility or suboptimal sperm quality.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Coenzyme Q10 as an adjunct therapy in non-surgical periodontitis treatment by analyzing randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The study found heterogeneous protocols and low reporting quality, with about half of the studies reporting significant improvements in probing pocket depth. No definitive conclusion on CoQ10's effectiveness was possible due to high risk of bias and insufficient data.
population_specificity: Patients with non-surgical periodontitis.
effective_dosage: Local administration once or several times up to 15 days; systemic administration twice or three times daily.
study_duration: Six weeks up to four months for systemic administration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review adjuvant therapies, including Coenzyme Q10, for genetic infertility and predict potential target genes and signaling pathways.
results_summary: The abstract mentions Coenzyme Q10 as part of antioxidant therapies recommended for infertility treatment, but specific results for Coenzyme Q10 alone are not detailed. The study suggests potential benefits based on existing knowledge and systematic reviews.
population_specificity: Individuals with genetic infertility (specifics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate cumulative studies and insights on Coenzyme Q10's role in the electron transport chain and antioxidant defense.
results_summary: The abstract suggests mixed results regarding CoQ10 supplementation, indicating a need for further studies to clarify its benefits as adjuvant therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of Coenzyme Q10 in female reproductive health, focusing on its antioxidant properties and potential to mitigate age-related decline and environmental toxin-induced reprotoxicity.
results_summary: The study found that CoQ10 supplementation can improve reproductive performance by reducing oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction, offering a low-risk strategy to counteract fertility decline related to aging and environmental chemical exposure.
population_specificity: Female reproductive health, with emphasis on age-related decline and environmental toxin exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the mechanisms of photobiomodulation (PBM) in reducing amyloid-beta (Aβ) toxicity, not specifically Coenzyme Q10.
results_summary: The abstract discusses PBM's potential to disassemble Aβ plaques directly and mentions formaldehyde-inhibited catalase, but it does not report findings on Coenzyme Q10.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract focuses on Alzheimer's disease and dementia broadly).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic role of Coenzyme Q10, among other antioxidants, in addressing male infertility caused by oxidative stress.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 showed notable potential in counteracting oxidative stress effects on sperm, contributing to improved sperm health and reproductive outcomes. However, limitations in the studies call for careful interpretation of these findings.
population_specificity: Males with infertility issues attributed to oxidative stress.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review evidence of secondary CoQ10 deficiency in various disorders and highlight conditions where CoQ10 supplementation showed significant clinical benefit.
results_summary: The study found that secondary CoQ10 deficiency is linked to a wide range of disorders and that supplementation can be clinically beneficial in some cases. It emphasized CoQ10's roles in metabolism, antioxidant activity, and other biochemical processes.
population_specificity: Individuals with secondary CoQ10 deficiency due to genetic mutations, oxidative stress, or pharmacological agents like statins.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between mitochondrial dysfunction (including mtDNA mutations, impaired mitophagy, and oxidative stress) and cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), and potential therapeutic strategies such as improving OXPHOS capacity.
results_summary: The abstract discusses mitochondrial dysfunction as a key mechanism in CVDs but does not specifically report results on Coenzyme Q10's effects. It mentions potential strategies like enhancing OXPHOS but lacks direct findings on CoQ10.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on cardiovascular diseases).

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the role of ferroptosis in Parkinson's disease and potential mechanisms of ferroptosis inhibitors, such as antioxidative capacity enhancement.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Coenzyme Q10's effects, focusing instead on ferroptosis and oxidative stress in Parkinson's disease.
population_specificity: People with Parkinson's disease (PD).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the role of endogenous formaldehyde in neurodegenerative diseases and potential oxidative stress mechanisms.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that excessive formaldehyde can induce oxidative stress, but it does not provide specific findings related to Coenzyme Q10's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize published efficacy and safety data for CAM, including Coenzyme Q10, in heart failure.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on Coenzyme Q10, only noting that clinical evidence for CAM in heart failure is limited and controversial.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure (general, no specific subgroup details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10) with other anti-inflammatory agents in improving treatment outcomes for bipolar disorder (BD) patients.
results_summary: CoQ10 was superior to other agents in terms of response rate (OR 18.85) and had high SUCRA values for both response (0.90) and remission rates (0.71), indicating strong efficacy. The study concluded that CoQ10 is effective but called for more high-quality clinical studies to verify its efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with bipolar disorder (BD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of CoQ10, alone or in combination, on male infertility, focusing on its impact on oxidative stress, sperm parameters, and pregnancy rates.
results_summary: CoQ10 was found to reduce testicular oxidative stress and sperm DNA fragmentation, improve sperm motility, and was associated with higher pregnancy rates, both naturally and through ART. Larger studies are needed to confirm its clinical efficacy.
population_specificity: Males with infertility issues.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation on cardiovascular disease risk factors and clinical outcomes.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 supplementation was associated with a reduction in all-cause mortality events (RR: 0.68; 95% CI: 0.49-0.94), indicating a significant benefit for cardiovascular health. The study classified it among micronutrients with moderate- to high-quality evidence for reducing CVD risk factors.
population_specificity: 883,627 participants (4,895,544 person-years) across multiple randomized controlled trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the anti-hypertensive and cardio-protective effects of Coenzyme Q10 and its proposed mechanisms of action.
results_summary: The study found that Coenzyme Q10 exhibits anti-hypertensive and cardio-protective effects, likely due to its vasoprotective, antioxidant, anti-proliferative, and anti-inflammatory properties. These effects contribute to attenuating chronic disease and protecting human health.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefit of CoQ10 supplementation, alongside other nutrients, in addressing mitochondrial dysfunction in neurodegenerative disorders.
results_summary: The study suggests that CoQ10, combined with other nutrients, may support mitochondrial function and ATP production in neurodegenerative disorders, though specific efficacy data is not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with neurodegenerative disorders (Parkinson's disease, Alzheimer's disease, ALS, multisystem atrophy, progressive supranuclear palsy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if adding Coenzyme Q10 to pregabalin improves symptoms in patients with painful diabetic neuropathy (PDN).
results_summary: CoQ10 + pregabalin provided significantly greater pain relief and improved sleep interference scores compared to placebo + pregabalin by weeks 4 and 8. More patients in the CoQ10 group reported meaningful improvement on global impression scales.
population_specificity: 112 patients with painful diabetic neuropathy (PDN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Coenzyme Q10 combined with vitamin E against WWFZYJ Decoction on semen quality and microplastic content in male infertility patients.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results for Coenzyme Q10, only stating it was used as a control treatment alongside vitamin E for comparison with WWFZYJ Decoction.
population_specificity: Male infertility patients (n=66, split into treatment and control groups).
effective_dosage: Not specified (Coenzyme Q10 tablets combined with vitamin E soft capsules).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Coenzyme Q10 combined with alpha lipoic acid could reduce symptoms of chronic COVID syndrome, particularly fatigue.
results_summary: The treatment group showed significantly higher rates of complete fatigue response (53.5%) compared to the control group (3.5%), with a statistically significant reduction in fatigue severity (p < 0.0001).
population_specificity: 174 patients with chronic COVID syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Coenzyme Q10, alone or combined with curcumin, could improve metabolic syndrome components such as blood pressure, lipid profiles, and glycemic control.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 showed no significant therapeutic effects on any metabolic syndrome components, either alone or in combination with curcumin. The study found no improvements in blood pressure, lipid profiles, glycemic control, or body composition.
population_specificity: 88 subjects with metabolic syndrome (hyperlipidemia, hypertension, hyperglycemia, insulin resistance, and abdominal obesity).

study_goal: To review recent therapeutic advances in Leber hereditary optic neuropathy (LHON), including the role of idebenone (a synthetic analog of Coenzyme Q10) and gene therapy.
results_summary: Idebenone, a Coenzyme Q10 analog, has been evaluated as prolonged treatment for LHON, showing potential benefits. Gene therapy trials (RESCUE, REVERSE, REFLECT) demonstrated visual acuity improvement, with bilateral injections showing significant improvement compared to unilateral ones.
population_specificity: Patients with Leber hereditary optic neuropathy (LHON) in early stages.
study_duration: Up to 3 years (for gene therapy trials)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether long-term supplementation with selenium and Coenzyme Q10 could prevent telomere attrition and reduce cardiovascular mortality in elderly individuals with low selenium levels.
results_summary: The study found that active treatment with selenium and Coenzyme Q10 resulted in less leukocyte telomere shortening compared to placebo, and this preservation of telomere length was associated with reduced cardiovascular mortality. Subjects who died had significantly shorter telomeres than survivors.
population_specificity: Swedish citizens aged 70−80 years with low selenium levels (n = 118).
study_duration: 4 years of intervention, with 10 years of follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation in improving insulin resistance, sex hormone levels, and blood lipids in patients with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
results_summary: The study found that Coenzyme Q10 supplementation significantly improved insulin resistance (reducing HOMA-IR, fasting insulin, and fasting plasma glucose), enhanced sex hormone levels (increasing FSH and reducing testosterone), and improved blood lipid profiles (reducing triglycerides, total cholesterol, LDL-C, and increasing HDL-C). Only one RCT reported adverse events, finding no adverse effects.
population_specificity: Patients with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) (1021 participants across 9 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the cardioprotective effects of Coenzyme Q10 and other dietary components in preventing cardiovascular diseases.
results_summary: The study found that Coenzyme Q10 exhibits cardioprotective effects on the heart and blood vessels, with additional benefits attributed to its antioxidant properties and potential to improve lipid profiles. The abstract also highlights the broader benefits of a varied diet rich in plant-derived sterols and polyphenols for cardiovascular health.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of dietary impacts on cardiovascular health).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current evidence on the protective effects of Coenzyme Q10 against acute kidney injury (AKI) due to the lack of existing reviews on the topic.
results_summary: CoQ10 demonstrated potent renal protective effects across various types of AKI, mediated by antiperoxidative, anti-apoptotic, and anti-inflammatory mechanisms, involving regulation of key genes and signaling pathways.
population_specificity: Not specified (includes clinical trials and experimental studies, but no specific human or animal population detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide updated information on the clinical and preclinical activities of Coenzyme Q10 to explore its potential therapeutic applications.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 acts as an efficient antioxidant and cofactor in mitochondrial electron transport, with roles in ATP synthesis, membrane stabilization, and cell growth. It exhibits diverse pharmacological effects, including neuroprotective, hepatoprotective, and cardiovascular benefits.
population_specificity: Humans and animals (not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of Coenzyme Q10 gel in treating periodontitis through a systematic review and meta-analysis of controlled trials.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 significantly reduced Plaque Index, Bleeding Index, gingival index, clinical attachment level, and Pocket Depth in periodontitis patients, suggesting meaningful therapeutic effects. However, the study acknowledges the need for higher-quality future research to confirm these findings.
population_specificity: Periodontitis patients

study_goal: The researchers were examining the role of endogenous antioxidants, including Coenzyme Q10, in ferroptosis, a form of regulated cell death.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Coenzyme Q10's effects, only mentioning its relevance as an endogenous antioxidant in the context of ferroptosis.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effects of CoQ10 supplementation on HDL function, specifically cholesterol efflux capacity and anti-inflammatory properties, in individuals with dyslipidemia.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation significantly improved HDL-mediated cholesterol efflux capacity and reduced HDL inflammatory index after 24 weeks, though it had no significant effect on HDL intrinsic oxidation. The benefits were more pronounced in elderly, female, or non-obese individuals.
population_specificity: 101 individuals with dyslipidemia (51 in CoQ10 group, 50 in placebo group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of antioxidants, including Coenzyme Q10, in improving muscle strength and physical activity in Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) patients.
results_summary: Two studies evaluated CoQ10 and reported clinical improvement in physical activity, though the abstract does not specify the extent or statistical significance of these improvements. No significant adverse events were noted.
population_specificity: Patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the available evidence on nutritional approaches, including Coenzyme Q10, for the treatment of bipolar disorder.
results_summary: The study found promising results associated with Coenzyme Q10 supplementation for improving symptoms of bipolar disorder, though specific details on its efficacy were not extensively detailed.
population_specificity: Individuals with bipolar disorder (BD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the functionalization, antimicrobial activity, and applications of copper-based nanoparticles (CBNPs), as well as their toxicity, biodistribution, and persistence.
results_summary: The review highlights that CBNPs exhibit broad antimicrobial capacity against drug-resistant bacteria and highly infectious viruses, though limitations and potential solutions are briefly discussed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of common salt treatment for umbilical granuloma, not Copper.
results_summary: The study found a 93.91% success rate with common salt application for umbilical granuloma, with no reported complications or recurrences. The review highlighted a lack of well-designed randomized controlled trials on this topic.
population_specificity: Patients with umbilical granuloma (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).
effective_dosage: Not specified (common salt application methods varied by study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of copper complexes, particularly those with dithiocarbamate ligands, as effective anticancer agents and their ability to re-sensitize cancer cells to platinum-based drugs.
results_summary: The study found that copper complexes with dithiocarbamate ligands show promising anticancer potential by disrupting copper homeostasis in cancer cells and inducing apoptosis through various mechanisms. These compounds may also help overcome resistance to platinum-based treatments.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research, not a clinical trial).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of disulfiram and copper as an add-on to alkylating chemotherapy in patients with recurrent glioblastoma.
results_summary: The study found that adding disulfiram and copper to chemotherapy increased toxic effects without improving survival outcomes compared to chemotherapy alone. Adverse events and serious adverse events were significantly higher in the disulfiram and copper group.
population_specificity: Adults (18+) with first recurrence of glioblastoma, eligible for alkylating chemotherapy.
study_duration: Patients were followed until death or a maximum of 24 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of copper ions in tumor development and evaluate the potential of copper-based nanotherapies for tumor treatment.
results_summary: The study found that elevated copper levels are closely associated with tumor progression and highlighted the potential of copper-based nanostructures for various tumor therapies, including copper depletion, cytotoxins, chemodynamic therapy, and activation of ferroptosis and cuproptosis. The authors also discussed future directions for clinical translation of copper-based nanomedicines.
population_specificity: Tumor tissues and serum (no specific human population mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent advances in understanding the physiological and cytological functions of ATOX1, a copper chaperone, and its role in human health and diseases, as well as explore its potential as a therapeutic target.
results_summary: The study found that ATOX1 plays a critical role in cellular copper homeostasis, antioxidative stress, transcriptional regulation, and is involved in diseases like neurodegenerative disorders, cancers, and metabolic diseases. It also regulates cell migration, proliferation, autophagy, DNA damage repair, and organism development.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human biology focus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the current understanding of copper's biological role in cancer biology, including its dual mechanisms of promoting cell growth (cuproplasia) and cell death (cuproptosis), and to explore potential copper-based strategies for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that copper plays a critical role in cancer growth, metastasis, and cell death, with both copper depletion and supplementation emerging as potential therapeutic approaches. It highlighted copper's regulatory functions in signaling transduction, gene expression, and its involvement in tumorigenesis, angiogenesis, and immunosuppressive microenvironment development.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature on cancer biology).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the reliability of non-bound ceruloplasmin copper (non-Cp Cu) as a biomarker for stratifying Alzheimer's disease (AD) into subtypes and assessing cognitive profiles.
results_summary: The study found that AD patients with elevated non-Cp Cu (>1.6 µmol/L) showed significant differences in executive function outcomes compared to those with normal levels, suggesting a distinct CuAD subtype. A genetic variant was identified in one CuAD patient, supporting the potential role of copper dysregulation in AD.
population_specificity: Alzheimer's disease patients (meta-analysis included ~6000 participants; specific study details not fully provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential therapeutic applications of metal nanoparticles, including copper oxide, in cancer and COVID-19 treatments.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the potential of metal nanoparticles, including copper oxide, as alternative nanotherapeutics for cancer and COVID-19, but notes challenges such as nanotoxicity, preparation complexity, and biodegradability.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of published studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of copper, among other supplements, in managing negative outcomes among COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: The abstract identifies copper as a mineral with potential to assist in managing COVID-19 patients, but specific results regarding its effectiveness are not detailed. The study suggests copper may be beneficial alongside standard care.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the relationship between copper concentrations in biological samples and morbidity/mortality outcomes in patients with systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS).
results_summary: Lower plasma/serum copper concentrations were observed in SIRS patients compared to controls upon admission. However, the study did not find differences in erythrocyte copper levels in SIRS patients.
population_specificity: Patients with SIRS, including adults in intensive care units (ICU) and pediatric ICU (PICU) patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the relationship between copper levels and COVID-19 severity in hospitalized older adults.
results_summary: The study found that severe COVID-19 forms were associated with lower zinc levels, but the abstract does not specify copper's direct effects or associations with outcomes.
population_specificity: Hospitalized older adults (average age 78 years) with COVID-19.
study_duration: Measurements taken within the first 15 days of hospitalization.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential mechanisms of copper-associated cell death and evaluate the effectiveness of copper-based biomaterials in antitumor therapy.
results_summary: The study found that copper modulates cancer cell survival through ROS accumulation, proteasome inhibition, and anti-angiogenesis, highlighting its potential in cancer diagnostics and therapy.
population_specificity: Tumor tissue and cancer cells (not specified for human or animal models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate silver's ability to interfere with copper metabolism, its potential health effects, and the risks of low silver concentrations to humans.
results_summary: The study discusses the chemical properties of silver that may disrupt copper metabolism and explores potential therapeutic uses of silver for severe diseases like tumors and viral infections by altering copper status.
population_specificity: Mammals (model systems, not specified further)

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the effects of zinc supplementation on mortality, morbidity, and growth in children aged 6 months to 12 years, with incidental reporting on serum markers such as copper.
results_summary: The study reported effects on serum markers including copper, but no specific conclusions or significant findings about copper's effects were highlighted in the abstract.
population_specificity: Children aged 6 months to 12 years, primarily in low- and middle-income countries.
effective_dosage: Not specified for copper (zinc dosage was 10-15 mg daily).
interactions: Co-supplementation of zinc with iron decreased the beneficial effect of zinc; no specific interactions mentioned for copper.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of different irrigant activation techniques (non-activation, passive ultrasonic irrigation, and EDDY sonic activation) in cleaning anastomoses in root canals, using a copper cube setup.
results_summary: All irrigation techniques significantly improved anastomosis cleanliness, with EDDY achieving the best overall results, particularly in the critical apical 2 mm region. Both activation techniques outperformed non-activation at all root canal levels.
population_specificity: Sixty anastomosis-containing mesial roots of mandibular molars mounted in resin and instrumented in a copper cube.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (irrigation techniques compared, not a dosage study).
study_duration: Not specified (in vitro study with immediate outcomes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the anticancer efficacy and mechanisms of action of 1,2,3-triazole-containing hybrids, focusing on their potential as novel anticancer agents.
results_summary: The study found that 1,2,3-triazole-containing hybrids can interact with enzymes and receptors in cancer cells, inhibit proliferation, arrest the cell cycle, and induce apoptosis, with potential for dual or multiple anticancer mechanisms.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro/in vivo studies, not specified for human trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the mechanism of cuproptosis (copper-dependent cell death) and its potential relationship with cancer, as well as therapeutic applications of copper ionophores in targeted cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study detailed copper's metabolic processes and tumor-related signaling pathways, identified cuproptosis as a unique form of cell death, and highlighted its potential role in cancer treatment through copper ionophores combined with small molecule drugs.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the in situ efficacy of copper surfaces in reducing microbial burden in healthcare settings compared to control surfaces.
results_summary: Two-thirds of the studies reported a significant reduction in microbial burden on copper surfaces. The highest-quality studies indicated that copper or copper alloys effectively decreased bacterial contamination on touch surfaces in healthcare settings.
population_specificity: Healthcare settings (no specific patient population detailed).
effective_dosage: Not specified (copper surfaces used, not oral dosage).
study_duration: Not specified (study duration not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and effectiveness of progestin-containing IUDs (LNG-IUD) versus copper-containing IUDs (Cu-IUD) for emergency contraception.
results_summary: The study found uncertain evidence regarding pregnancy rates, insertion failure, expulsion, and removal rates between LNG-IUD and Cu-IUD. Cu-IUD may slightly increase cramping, while LNG-IUD may slightly increase bleeding and spotting days.
population_specificity: Women seeking emergency contraception (711 participants in the included study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the causal association of blood copper levels with lung cancer risk using Mendelian randomization analyses.
results_summary: The study found that higher blood copper levels were significantly associated with an increased risk of lung cancer (OR 1.14, 95% CI 1.01-1.29; P = 0.039), indicating a potential hazard effect.
population_specificity: Individuals from 10 genome-wide association studies (GWAS) consortia and other GWAS databases, totaling 4,944,052 participants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the relationship between copper homeostasis, cuproptosis-related pathways, and therapeutic strategies for cardiovascular disease (CVD).
results_summary: The study highlights that copper-induced cell death (cuproptosis) plays a significant role in the pathogenesis and progression of CVD, including atherosclerosis, stroke, ischemia-reperfusion injury, and heart failure. It suggests that understanding these mechanisms could improve CVD management.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of CVD-related mechanisms).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the dual role of copper in colorectal cancer progression and treatment, focusing on its redox properties and potential toxicity.
results_summary: The study found that copper's redox properties can be harnessed for anti-cancer drug development, but its toxicity may contribute to oxidative stress and cancer. Altered copper homeostasis plays a crucial role in colorectal tumor proliferation and metastasis, making it a potential therapeutic target.
population_specificity: Colorectal cancer patients (not specified if human or preclinical models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether nanoformulated diethyldithiocarbamate (DE) with green synthesized copper oxide (Cu) could effectively disrupt redox balance and eliminate cancer stem cells (CSCs).
results_summary: The study found that DE, when nanoformulated with copper oxide, enhanced the selective eradication of CSCs by inhibiting the radical detoxifying enzyme ALDH1A. The combination showed augmented effectiveness compared to DE alone.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely in vitro or preclinical models, given the abstract's focus on mechanisms).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticancer potential of copper-containing compounds, focusing on their mechanisms of action, including redox-mediated pathways and photodynamic therapy.
results_summary: Copper complexes demonstrated broad-spectrum anticancer activity, inducing necrosis, apoptosis, and angiogenesis through reactive oxygen species generation and DNA cleavage. Light-assisted excitation of Cu(II) complexes enhanced their anticancer effects via photodynamic mechanisms.
population_specificity: Various cancer cell lines (in vitro and in vivo studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential therapeutic applications of copper complexes supported on nanostructured silica, particularly against cancer and bacteria.
results_summary: The study highlights the use of copper complexes on silica-based materials for cytotoxic effects against diseases, with promising preclinical results in vivo, though detailed efficacy data specific to copper is not extensively discussed.
population_specificity: Preclinical models (in vivo studies, specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the potential link between metal exposure (including Copper) and neurodegeneration through oxidative stress.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that metal exposure, including Copper, may increase oxidative stress in brain cells, leading to cell death and neurodegeneration, but specific results about Copper are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of copper-based complexes as anticancer agents, focusing on their cytotoxic effects and DNA-binding affinity.
results_summary: Copper-containing complexes demonstrated high DNA-binding affinity and cytotoxic effects against malignant cells, with a positive correlation between binding affinity and cytotoxicity. The complexes exhibited a multimodal mechanism of action involving angiogenesis inhibition, ROS-induced DNA damage, and apoptosis.
population_specificity: Malignant cell types (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of cuproptosis-related lncRNAs in bladder cancer prognosis and develop a predictive model.
results_summary: The study identified a 17-lncRNA signature that independently predicted bladder cancer prognosis, with higher risk scores correlating with poorer survival. In vitro experiments confirmed elevated expression of these lncRNAs in bladder cancer cells after cuproptosis induction by copper ions.
population_specificity: Bladder cancer patients (data derived from The Cancer Genome Atlas).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of copper in normal brain functioning and its association with neurodegeneration in Alzheimer's disease (AD), as well as the therapeutic potential of metal chelators.
results_summary: The study found that abnormal accumulation of copper in the brain is linked to neuronal degeneration, Aβ aggregation, and Tau formation in AD, but the therapeutic benefits of chelation remain ambiguous.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on Alzheimer's disease patients and brain metal homeostasis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify the role of copper (Cu) in autism spectrum disorder (ASD), particularly its relationship with zinc and its impact on gene expression of metallothioneins (MTs).
results_summary: The study found that autistic individuals frequently exhibit copper excess combined with zinc deficiency, which may contribute to ASD pathogenesis. Higher serum copper levels were significantly associated with ASD.
population_specificity: Autistic children and individuals with ASD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the role of copper accumulation in Wilson's disease (WD) and evaluate diagnostic and treatment approaches for managing copper overload.
results_summary: The study found that WD leads to pathological copper accumulation primarily in the liver and central nervous system, causing a spectrum of symptoms from asymptomatic to acute liver failure. Treatment with chelating agents (penicillamine, trientine) and zinc salts effectively manages copper levels, while liver transplantation is necessary for end-stage disease.
population_specificity: Patients with Wilson's disease (a hereditary disorder of copper metabolism).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the indications, effectiveness, safety, and side effects of emergency contraceptive methods, including the copper IUD.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the copper IUD as one of the current emergency contraception options in the U.S., noting its effectiveness but does not provide specific results regarding its performance compared to other methods. Further research is needed to evaluate the effectiveness of LNG IUDs and other emergency contraceptive options.
population_specificity: General population, particularly individuals seeking emergency contraception.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review molecular aspects of substantia nigra functioning in schizophrenia patients compared to healthy controls.
results_summary: The study found evidence of hyperdopaminergic functioning in the substantia nigra of schizophrenia patients, including increased AADC activity and elevated neuromelanin accumulation, as well as reduced GABAergic inhibition.
population_specificity: Patients with schizophrenia and healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify differentiating clinical criteria, evaluate genotype-phenotype correlations, and propose management guidelines for ATP7A-related disorders.
results_summary: The study found that early seizures are specific for classical Menkes disease (CMD), ataxia indicates atypical Menkes disease, and bony exostoses and other connective tissue manifestations are specific for occipital horn syndrome (OHS). Low ceruloplasmin was identified as a more sensitive biomarker than serum copper for ATP7A-related disorders.
population_specificity: 162 individuals with molecularly confirmed ATP7A-related disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of redox-active biometals, including copper, in oxidative stress, neuronal death, and their potential link to Parkinson's disease (PD).
results_summary: The study found that copper dysregulation (deficiency or overload) is associated with pathological processes in the CNS, including dopaminergic neuronal loss in the substantia nigra, and may contribute to PD development through oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of biometals' effects on the CNS, with implications for PD risk).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how hormonal contraceptives affect the local immune environment and microbiota in the female genital tract and their potential impact on HIV susceptibility.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Copper's effects.
population_specificity: Malawian women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify cuproptosis-related lncRNAs in breast cancer and construct a prognostic model to predict survival outcomes.
results_summary: The study identified 10 cuproptosis-related lncRNAs and developed a prognostic model that effectively distinguished high-risk and low-risk breast cancer patients, showing significant differences in overall survival and tumor mutation burden. The model demonstrated high diagnostic efficiency and independent prognostic value.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients from The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) database.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the prevalence and types of contraception use, including copper IUDs, between breast cancer survivors and matched controls.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in overall contraception prevalence between breast cancer survivors and controls, but copper IUD use was significantly higher among survivors (59.5% vs. 25.0%). Receiving information about chemotherapy-induced ovary damage and anti-HER2 treatment was associated with higher contraception use.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-43 years with localized breast cancer and matched cancer-free controls in France.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prognostic role of cuproptosis-related lncRNAs (CRlncRNAs) in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) and develop a risk model for predicting patient outcomes.
results_summary: The study identified 10 CRlncRNAs (5 high-risk and 5 protective) that accurately predicted LUAD prognosis. The risk model demonstrated robust predictive power, validated through multiple analyses, and provided insights for LUAD diagnosis and treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) from the Cancer Genome Atlas database.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of vitamin D supplementation on copper metabolism in adolescent patients with keratoconus.
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation increased the cell availability of copper, and stabilization of keratoconus progression was observed in 60% of patients after 12 months.
population_specificity: Adolescent patients (age 16-19 years) with keratoconus and vitamin D insufficiency (<30 ng/mL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of copper (Cu) nanoparticles as part of antiviral therapy, particularly for viruses like COVID-19.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that copper nanoparticles, among other metal/metal oxide nanoparticles, are promising candidates for antiviral therapy, but specific efficacy data for copper alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of antiviral applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the best method (manual vs. forceps) for inserting post-placental IUDs in the immediate postpartum period to improve contraception effectiveness.
results_summary: The study compared expulsion rates, discomfort, perforation rates, and proper IUD positioning between manual and forceps insertion methods, with follow-up at 40-60 days postpartum. The abstract suggests that the benefit of IUD insertion outweighs the higher expulsion rate, but specific comparative results are not detailed.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-43 admitted for vaginal birth at the Women's Hospital of the State University of Campinas who chose IUD contraception.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to discuss the potential of various substances, including copper, to cause liver injury through oxidative stress mechanisms.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that copper, like other exogenous hepatotoxins, may cause liver injury via overproduction of reactive oxidative species (ROS), leading to mitochondrial dysfunction and membrane damage. However, specific data on copper's effects are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of hepatotoxicants)
